  16. (** Character operations. *)

  18. external code : char -> int = "%identity"
  19. (** Return the ASCII code of the argument. *)

  21. ‌val chr : int -> char
  22. (** Return the character with the given ASCII code.
  23.    @raise Invalid_argument if the argument is
  24.    outside the range 0--255. *)

  26. ‌val escaped : char -> string
  27. (** Return a string representing the given character,
  28.     with special characters escaped following the lexical conventions
  29.     of OCaml.
  30.     All characters outside the ASCII printable range (32..126) are
  31.     escaped, as well as backslash, double-quote, and single-quote. *)

  33. ‌val lowercase_ascii : char -> char
  34. (** Convert the given character to its equivalent lowercase character,
  35.    using the US-ASCII character set.
  36.    @since 4.03 *)

  38. ‌val uppercase_ascii : char -> char
  39. (** Convert the given character to its equivalent uppercase character,
  40.    using the US-ASCII character set.
  41.    @since 4.03 *)

  43. ‌type t = char
  44. (** An alias for the type of characters. *)

  46. ‌val compare: t -> t -> int
  47. (** The comparison function for characters, with the same specification as
  48.     {!Stdlib.compare}.  Along with the type [t], this function [compare]
  49.     allows the module [Char] to be passed as argument to the functors
  50.     {!Set.Make} and {!Map.Make}. *)

  52. ‌val equal: t -> t -> bool
  53. (** The equal function for chars.
  54.     @since 4.03 *)

  56. ‌val seeded_hash : int -> t -> int
  57. (** A seeded hash function for characters, with the same output value as
  58.     {!Hashtbl.seeded_hash}. This function allows this module to be passed as
  59.     argument to the functor {!Hashtbl.MakeSeeded}.

  61.     @since 5.1 *)

  63. ‌val hash : t -> int
  64. (** An unseeded hash function for characters, with the same output value as
  65.     {!Hashtbl.hash}. This function allows this module to be passed as argument
  66.     to the functor {!Hashtbl.Make}.

  68.     @since 5.1 *)

  70. (**/**)

  72. (* The following is for system use only. Do not call directly. *)

  74. external unsafe_chr : int -> char = "%identity"
